intro: Brachistus lindenii, commonly known as the Lindenhof dandelion, is a species of flowering plant in the family Asteraceae. It is native to southern Africa, particularly South Africa, and thrives in arid and semi-arid environments. The plant produces yellow flowers that develop into fluffy white seed heads, typical of the dandelion genus. It has a basal rosette of narrow, gray-green leaves that are hairy and adapted to reduce water loss. Brachistus lindenii is often found in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand harsh climatic conditions.
